com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhivePointIf

public interface XhivePointIf

Represents a point in a DOM tree.

The XhivePointIf interface represents a point in a DOM tree, typically returned as part of a location set (see XhiveLocationIteratorIf) in an XPointer result. A point is specified by its container node and an index, as defined in the XPointer specification (see the specs for details). This interface retrieves both container nodes and indexes. However, you cannot set these through this interface, because they are the result of an XPointer query.

Note that an XhivePointIf object is not a "live" object, in the sense that it keeps pointing to the same location in the DOM tree as changes occur in the tree. Both the container node and the index remain the same throughout the life cycle of the XhivePointIf object.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Summary
 Node getContainerNode()
          Get the container node for this point, as set during the execution of an XPointer query.

          Get the index for this point, as set during the execution of an XPointer query.
